intro: Dolichothrix, commonly known as the slender thornapple, is a genus of flowering plants in the nightshade family, Solanaceae. It is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, clustered flowers that range from white to purple in color. The leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy surface. The fruit is a capsule that contains numerous tiny seeds, and the plant is native to regions of southern Africa. Dolichothrix species are often found in dry, rocky habitats and are adapted to thrive in arid environments.
